alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Mayes, Wagoner, northern Cherokee, northeastern Okmulgee, northwestern Muskogee and southeastern Tulsa Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 126 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sportsmen Acres Community to 4 miles southeast of Inola to 4 miles east of Jenks Riverside Airport. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Wagoner... Bixby... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... Fort Gibson... Haskell... Locust Grove... Okay... Hulbert... Porter... Taft... Tullahassee... Peggs... Jenks Riverside Airport... Stonebluff... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Tulsa; Wagoner
